Jennifer Martinez.

I understand the confusion. Often there can be remaining balances after insurance payments. This is the outstanding amount that wasn't covered by your insurance provider.
I see. How old is this debt?
The account was opened in May twenty twenty three, so it's been about two and a half years. It was sent to our agency for collection six months ago.

Yes, can you email it to me?
I'd be happy to. What's the best email address to send it to?
It's jennifer dot martinez at email dot com.
Perfect. I'll send that to jennifer dot martinez at email dot com. You should receive it within the next few minutes. Now, would you still like to take care of the balance today?
Well, I guess so. But can I ask, are there any payment plan options?

Yes, we do offer payment plans. However, since your balance is under five hundred dollars, we typically recommend paying it in full if possible to close the account completely. But if you need a payment plan, I can set that up for you. What would work better for you?
How would a payment plan work exactly?

We could set up monthly payments over three to six months depending on what you can afford. Each payment would be automatically charged to your card on a specific date each month until the balance is paid off.

There are no additional fees for setting up a payment plan. The total amount would still be four hundred fifty two dollars and thirty cents.

Yes, your account balance is now zero and the account will be updated as paid in full. This should reflect on your credit report within thirty to sixty days.

Having the account marked as paid in full is definitely better than having an outstanding collection. While I can't predict exact credit score changes, resolving the debt is a positive step.
